Pre-Game Insights: Malawi national football team, the Flames take on Burkina Faso in Group L second match in the 2025 Total Energies Africa Cup of Nations (Afcon) qualifier.
The Flames will be looking to quickly bounce back from the 3-2 loss at home against Burundi.
Both teams are aiming for their first victory in the qualifiers after dropping points in their respective opening matches.
The Stallions held Senegal to a 1-1 draw in their opening match.
Malawi and Burkina Faso have met six times since 2000, but the Stallions have won four matches, with two matches ending in draws.
The Flames are seeking their first-ever victory against Burkina Faso in all competitions since 2000.
Malawi arrived in Bamako, Mali on Saturday.
Flames coach Patrick Mabedi said the boys were determined to get the first win in the qualifiers.
Mabedi emphasized the need for discipline and utilisation of chances.
The best way of defending is attacking, according to Mabedi, as sitting back would invite problems and mistakes.
Senegal moved top of Group L after beating Burundi 1-0.
